container.heading: Correction or Amendment of Personal Records

section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: This chapter establishes procedures for a person in interest to request the correction or amendment of personal records in the Department of Human Services or the local department under State Government Article, §10-625, Annotated Code of Maryland.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Administration" means any of the following administrations within the Department of Human Services:
Social Services Administration;
Family Investment Administration; or
Child Support Administration.
"Custodian" means an authorized employee of the Department, an administration, or a local department having actual control and custody of a record.
"Department" means the Department of Human Services, its administrations, and the local departments.
"Local department" means the local department of social services in a county or Baltimore City, and the Montgomery County Department of Health and Human Services.
"Official custodian" means the executive head of the Department, administration, or local department in which a record is located.
"Person in interest" means:
The person, governmental unit, or entity that is the subject of a public record; or
The legal guardian of the person who is the subject of a public record.
"Personal record" means a public record that identifies an individual by name, address, description, finger or voice print, picture, or other identifying factors.
"Secretary" means the Secretary of Human Services.

section.heading: Who May Request.
section.text: A person in interest may request the Department or a local department to correct or amend a personal record pursuant to State Government Article, §10-625, Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Procedures for Requesting Correction or Amendment of Personal Records.
section.text: The request shall be in writing and state the:

para.text: Name, address, and telephone number of the requestor;
Identity of the record the requestor is seeking to correct or amend;
Precise correction or amendment requested; and
Justification for the correction or amendment.

section.heading: Filing the Request.
section.text: A request to correct or amend a personal record of the Department or a local department shall be addressed to the custodian of the record.

section.heading: Procedures for Responding to a Request for Correction or Amendment of Personal Records.
section.text: Within 30 days after receipt of a request for correction or amendment of personal records that:

para.text: Complies with Regulations .04 and .05 of this chapter, the custodian shall:
Make the requested correction or amendment and notify the requestor in writing; or
Inform the requestor in writing that the record may not be amended or corrected as requested because:
The requestor is not a person in interest,
The record to be corrected or amended is not a personal record,
The requestor is not entitled to inspect the records under State Government Article, §10-611 et seq., Annotated Code of Maryland, or
Other reasons mandated by law; or
Does not comply with Regulation .04 of this chapter, the custodian shall return the request to the requestor:
With an explanation for the return; and
Procedures for resubmitting the request.

section.heading: Notification to Third Party.
section.text: If the custodian previously disclosed information from a personal record to a third party and receives a request for correction or amendment to the personal record, the custodian:

para.text: Shall inform the third party in writing within 30 days of the correction or amendment to the personal record; or
Does not need to notify the third party, if the custodian denies the request.

If the Department or local department finally refuses a request to make a correction or amendment pursuant to Regulation .06, the person in interest may submit to the Department or local department a concise statement, not to exceed five 8-1/2 x 11 inch pages, of the reasons for:
The requested correction or amendment; and
Disagreement with the Department or local department's refusal to make the requested correction or amendment.

The Department or local department which discloses to a third party information from a personal record about which a statement of disagreement has been filed, shall furnish a copy of the statement to the third party.
A requestor may seek an administrative review in accordance with State Government Article, Title 10, Subtitle 2, Annotated Code of Maryland, if the requestor has been denied:
A request to change a personal record;
The right to file a statement of disagreement; or
The right to have a statement of disagreement forwarded to a third party.
An individual shall file a request for administrative review within 30 days of the date of the custodian's decision to deny a request to change a personal record.
The administrative hearing shall be:
Conducted by the Office of Administrative Hearings; and
Governed by the Administrative Procedure Act, State Government Article, Title 10, Subtitle 2, Annotated Code of Maryland.
